name: A. Ryouko s Memory Note
statement:
Ryouko is an extremely forgetful girl, she could even forget something
that has just happened. So in order to remember, she takes a notebook
with her, called . She writes what she sees and what she hears on the
notebook, and the notebook became her memory.Though Ryouko is forgetful,
she is also born with superb analyzing abilities. However, analyzing
depends greatly on gathered information, in other words, memory. So she
has to shuffle through her notebook whenever she needs to analyze, which
is tough work.Ryouko’s notebook consists of pages, numbered from 1 to .
To make life (and this problem) easier, we consider that to turn from
page to page , pages should be turned. During analyzing, Ryouko needs
pieces of information, the -th piece of information is on page .
Information must be read from the notebook in order, so the total number
of pages that Ryouko needs to turn is .Ryouko wants to decrease the
number of pages that need to be turned. In order to achieve this, she
can merge two pages of her notebook. If Ryouko merges page to page , she
would copy all the information on page to , and consequently, all
elements in sequence that was would become . Note that can be equal to ,
in which case no changes take place.Please tell Ryouko the minimum
number of pages that she needs to turn. Note she can apply the described
operation at most once before the reading. Note that the answer can
exceed 32-bit integers.
